definitions.definition: An institution, building, or room for the exhibition and conservation of works of art.
An establishment that buys, sells, and displays works of art.
The uppermost seating area projecting from the rear or side walls of a theater, concert hall, or auditorium.
The, often elevated and in the rear, part of a courtroom where seating for the public audience is facilitated during trial.
A roofed promenade, especially one extending along the wall of a building and supported by arches or columns on the outer side
The spectators of an event, collectively.
A browsable collection of images, font styles, etc.
definitions.example: a clip-art gallery in a wordprocessor

definitions.definition: (fortification) A covered passage cut through the earth or masonry.
A level or drive in a mine.
